TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AggregateCacheDependency extends System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency
Public NotInheritable Class AggregateCacheDependency Inherits CacheDependency
public ref class AggregateCacheDependency sealed : System::Web::Caching::CacheDependency

Docs.summary: Combines multiple dependencies between an item stored in an ASP.NET application's object and an array of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class monitors a collection of dependency objects so that when any of them change, the cached item is automatically removed. The objects in the array can be <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> objects, <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> objects, custom objects derived from <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency>, or any combination of these.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class differs from the <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> class in that it allows you to associate multiple dependencies of different types with a single cached item. For example, if you create a page that imports data from a SQL Server database table and an XML file, you can create a <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object to represent a dependency on the database table and a <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> to represent the dependency on the XML file. Rather than making an <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache.Insert%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method call for each dependency, you can create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class with each dependency added to it. You can then use a single <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache.Insert%2A> call to make the page dependent on the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> instance.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class to add a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, named `XMLDataSet`, to the cache that is dependent on a text file and an XML file.
[!code-vb[CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1/VB/aggregatecachedependencysamplevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the default constructor for the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class.
## Examples The following code example creates an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class, using the constructor that takes no arguments. Two <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> objects are created, then added to a <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> array, `myDepArray`. This constructor is used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency.Add%2A> method to make the item stored in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache> dependent on both <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> objects.
[!code-vb[CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1/VB/aggregatecachedependencysamplevb.aspx#3)]

Public Sub Add (ParamArray dependencies As CacheDependency())

Docs.param: The array of objects to add.
Docs.summary: Adds an array of objects to the object.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency.Add%2A> method in conjunction with the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create two <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> objects, add them to a <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> array named `myDepArray`, and then make the item in the cache dependent on those two <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> objects.
[!code-vb[CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1/VB/aggregatecachedependencysamplevb.aspx#3)]

.method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetUniqueID() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetUniqueID () As String

Docs.summary: Retrieves a unique identifier for the object.
Docs.returns: The unique identifier for the object. If one of the associated dependency objects does not have a unique identifier, the method returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method assigns a unique identifier to each dependency in the array and returns each of them. The identifier is a combination of either the file name (for a file dependency) or the key name (for a cache-key dependency) and a string that this method assigns to the dependency.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency.GetUniqueID%2A> method to create and display an identifier for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class, named `aggDep`, once it is created and populated.
[!code-vb[CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CachingSamples_AggregateCacheDependency1/VB/aggregatecachedependencysamplevb.aspx#3)]
